revised_title: Sextactic Points of a Plane Curve: A Study in Geometry
tldr: The author, William Spottiswoode, explores the mathematical formulas and equations involved in determining the sextactic points of a plane curve. Sextactic points are points on a curve where a sixth consecutive point lies on a specific conic. The author provides a detailed analysis of the equations and their applications, contributing to the understanding of the geometry and properties of plane curves.
